title: What is "sanspareil"?
content: What is the meaning of the word "sanspareil" in the expressions "the sanspareil matrix cutting method" and "sanspareil 8-lines Pica"? I found them while reading the book 'Stephenson Blake, The last of the Old English Typefounders.'
author: Nymus

comments.content:
You will find it at the follwing link:

[http://www.archive.org/details/dictionaryoftypo00sout](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020175054/http:/www.archive.org/details/dictionaryoftypo00sout "http://www.archive.org/details/dictionaryoftypo00sout")

dictionaryoftypo00sout.pdf page 62.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020175054im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sanspareil_4839.jpg)
Also of interest: in French, "sans pareil" means "unique" or "without equal" or "unparalleled"... hence it is a good term for naming a process that is considered superior to others.

That's a rather lousy definition. I know that a) it's peculiar and b) not sand casting.

Still curious as to what it is, though.
